column4: i have a newb question here, really newbie ;]  i downloaded thunderbird, and decompressed it to my temp folder and i cant figure out how to install it
happen to recall the filename extension of what you downloaded?
couple of thoughts.  First, Ubuntu probably has Thunderbird packaged, and unless you've got a reason to use the newest version, you'd probably be better off with the package
if you do want to install from the tarball, you've almost certainly got the right filename.  Might want to run it with sudo, e.g. "sudo /path/mo\zilla-installer-bin"
(a) did you install with english as the default language/etc?
(b) have you tried synaptic? (System->administration->Synaptic package manager)
ouch.  Where did you find them?
ok.  lemme see.  What's in your sources.list file?
in synaptic, go back to the categories view, and find the "email" category
errm, could you paste your sources.list file into http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/?
got that sources.list file open in an editor?  Take the '#' off the beginning of lines 3 and 4.  Get rid of the first space too, so that they start with "deb"
save.  Close synaptic and restart it
when you get synaptic restarted, click "reload"
depends on the error.  PRobably not, but let's cross our fingers

good.  Sources.list is an important file in debian and in ubuntu.  You'll want to probably "uncomment" a few more of those lines as time goes on.  There's more information on the support pages at ubuntulinux.com
now if only someone knew the answer to my question =D
yeah, you can use synaptic to remove packages as well
